nodes.documentation:
@title Branded Token.
 * @notice Branded tokens are minted by staking specified value tokens.
nodes.name: BrandedToken

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ValueToken decimals does not equal brandedToken decimals."

arguments.value: ValueToken decimals does not equal brandedToken decimals.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ValueToken decimals does not equal brandedToken decimals."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Mint is not equivalent to stake."

arguments.value: Mint is not equivalent to stake.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Mint is not equivalent to stake."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Staker has a stake request hash."

arguments.value: Staker has a stake request hash.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Staker has a stake request hash."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfers value tokens from msg.sender to itself,
        stores the amount of branded tokens to mint if request
        is accepted, and emits stake request information.
     * @dev It is expected that this contract will have a sufficientallowance
     to transfer value tokens from the staker at the time this function
     is executed.
     *      Function requires:
         - _mint is equivalent to _stake
         - msg.sender does not have a stake request hash
         - valueToken.transferFrom returns true
     * @param _stake Amount of value tokens to stake.
@param _mint Amount of branded tokens to mint.
     * @return stakeRequestHash_ Hash of stake request information calculated per
                          EIP 712.
nodes.name: requestStake
acceptStakeRequest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Maps addresses in _restrictionLifted to true in unrestricted.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
     * @param _restrictionLifted Addresses for which to lift restrictions.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: liftRestriction
isUnrestricted

nodes.documentation:
@notice Lifts restrictions from all actors.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is organization
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: liftAllRestrictions

nodes.documentation:
@notice Revokes stake request by deleting its information and
        transferring staked value tokens back to staker.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is staker
         - valueToken.transfer returns true
     * @param _stakeRequestHash Stake request hash.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: revokeStakeRequest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Reduces msg.sender's balance and the total supply by
        _brandedTokens and transfers an equivalent amount of
        value tokens to msg.sender.
     * @dev Redemption may risk loss of branded tokens.
     It is possible to redeem branded tokens for 0 value tokens.
     *      Function requires:
         - valueToken.transfer returns true
     * @param _brandedTokens Amount of branded tokens to redeem.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: redeem

nodes.documentation:
@notice Rejects stake request by deleting its information and
        transferring staked value tokens back to staker.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
         - stake request exists
         - valueToken.transfer returns true
     * @param _stakeRequestHash Stake request hash.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: rejectStakeRequest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets symbol.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
     * @param _symbol The value to which symbol is set.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: setSymbol

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets name.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
     * @param _name The value to which name is set.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: setName
transfer
transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@notice Returns the amount of branded tokens equivalent to a
        given amount of value tokens.
     * @dev Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of
     this token (i.e., assuming 1 value token is equivalent
     to 3.5 branded tokens, convert(1) --> 3, not 3.5).
     * @param _valueTokens Amount to convert.
     * @return uint256 Converted amount.
nodes.name: convertToBrandedTokens

nodes.documentation:
@notice Returns the amount of value tokens equivalent to a
        given amount of branded tokens.
     * @dev Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of
     this token.
     * @param _brandedTokens Amount to convert.
     * @return uint256 Converted amount.
nodes.name: convertToValueTokens
hash

nodes.documentation:
@notice Verifies whether signer of stakeRequestHash is a worker.
     * @dev Signing the stakeRequestHash consistent with eth_signTypedData,
     as specified by EIP 712, requires signing a hash of encoded data
     comprising:
         - an initial byte
         - the version byte for structured data
         - the domain separator
         - the stakeRequestHash
     *      See: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-712.md
     * @param _stakeRequest Stake request.
@param _r R of the signature.
@param _s S of the signature.
@param _v V of the signature.
     * @return bool True if signer is a worker, false if not.
nodes.name: verifySigner

@notice Reduces msg.sender's balance and the total supply by
        _brandedTokens and transfers an equivalent amount of
        value tokens to msg.sender.
     * @dev Redemption may risk loss of branded tokens.
     It is possible to redeem branded tokens for 0 value tokens.
     *      Function requires:
         - valueToken.transfer returns true
     * @param _brandedTokens Amount of branded tokens to redeem.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: redeem

nodes.documentation:
@notice Rejects stake request by deleting its information and
        transferring staked value tokens back to staker.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
         - stake request exists
         - valueToken.transfer returns true
     * @param _stakeRequestHash Stake request hash.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: rejectStakeRequest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets symbol.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
     * @param _symbol The value to which symbol is set.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: setSymbol

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets name.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is a worker
     * @param _name The value to which name is set.
     * @return success_ True.
nodes.name: setName
transfer
transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@notice Returns the amount of branded tokens equivalent to a
        given amount of value tokens.
     * @dev Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of
     this token (i.e., assuming 1 value token is equivalent
     to 3.5 branded tokens, convert(1) --> 3, not 3.5).
     * @param _valueTokens Amount to convert.
     * @return uint256 Converted amount.
nodes.name: convertToBrandedTokens

nodes.documentation:
@notice Returns the amount of value tokens equivalent to a
        given amount of branded tokens.
     * @dev Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of
     this token.
     * @param _brandedTokens Amount to convert.
     * @return uint256 Converted amount.
nodes.name: convertToValueTokens
hash

nodes.documentation:
@notice Verifies whether signer of stakeRequestHash is a worker.
     * @dev Signing the stakeRequestHash consistent with eth_signTypedData,
     as specified by EIP 712, requires signing a hash of encoded data
     comprising:
         - an initial byte
         - the version byte for structured data
         - the domain separator
         - the stakeRequestHash
     *      See: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-712.md
     * @param _stakeRequest Stake request.
@param _r R of the signature.
@param _s S of the signature.
@param _v V of the signature.
     * @return bool True if signer is a worker, false if not.
nodes.name: verifySigner

acceptStakeRequest(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.details: The function has no access controls, but will only accept     the signature of a worker, as defined in Organization.     *      Function requires:         - stake request exists         - signature is from a worker

allowance(address,address).return: Remaining allowance for the spender to spend from         owner's account.

approve(address,uint256).details: Allows _spender address to withdraw from function caller's      account, multiple times up to the _value amount, if this      function is called again it overwrites the current allowance      with _value.

params._spender: Address authorized to spend from the function caller's                 address.
params._value: Amount up to which spender is authorized to spend.

approve(address,uint256).return: success_ True for a successful approval, false otherwise.

balanceOf(address).return: Account balance of the owner account.

constructor.details: Conversion parameters provide the conversion rate and its scale.     For example, if 1 value token is equivalent to 3.5 branded     tokens (1:3.5), _conversionRate == 35 and     _conversionRateDecimals == 1.     *      The value token is expected to have a `decimals` function.     *      Constructor requires:         - valueToken address is not zero         - conversionRate is not zero         - conversionRateDecimals is not greater than 5         - valueToken.decimals == decimals

params._conversionRate: The value to which conversionRate is set.
params._conversionRateDecimals: The value to which                               conversionRateDecimals is set.
params._decimals: The value to which tokenDecimals, defined in EIP20Token,                 is set.
params._name: The value to which tokenName, defined in EIP20Token,             is set.
params._organization: The value to which organization, defined in Organized,                     is set.
params._symbol: The value to which tokenSymbol, defined in EIP20Token,               is set.
params._valueToken: The value to which valueToken is set.

convertToBrandedTokens(uint256).details: Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of     this token (i.e., assuming 1 value token is equivalent     to 3.5 branded tokens, convert(1) --> 3, not 3.5).

convertToValueTokens(uint256).details: Please note there may be a loss of up to 1 indivisible unit of     this token.

liftRestriction(address[]).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is a worker

params._restrictionLifted: Addresses for which to lift restrictions.

redeem(uint256).details: Redemption may risk loss of branded tokens.     It is possible to redeem branded tokens for 0 value tokens.     *      Function requires:         - valueToken.transfer returns true

params._brandedTokens: Amount of branded tokens to redeem.

rejectStakeRequest(bytes32).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is a worker         - stake request exists         - valueToken.transfer returns true

requestStake(uint256,uint256).details: It is expected that this contract will have a sufficientallowance     to transfer value tokens from the staker at the time this function     is executed.     *      Function requires:         - _mint is equivalent to _stake         - msg.sender does not have a stake request hash         - valueToken.transferFrom returns true

params._mint: Amount of branded tokens to mint.
params._stake: Amount of value tokens to stake.

requestStake(uint256,uint256).return: stakeRequestHash_ Hash of stake request information calculated per                          EIP 712.

revokeStakeRequest(bytes32).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is staker         - valueToken.transfer returns true

setName(string).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is a worker

params._name: The value to which name is set.

setSymbol(string).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is a worker

params._symbol: The value to which symbol is set.

totalSupply().details: Get totalTokenSupply as view so that child cannot edit.

params._to: Address to which tokens are transferred.
params._value: Amount of tokens to be transferred.

params._from: Address from which tokens are transferred.
params._to: Address to which tokens are transferred.

acceptStakeRequest(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.notice: Mints and transfers branded tokens to a staker,        increases the total token supply, and        emits stake request acceptance and transfer information.

convertToBrandedTokens(uint256).notice: Returns the amount of branded tokens equivalent to a        given amount of value tokens.

convertToValueTokens(uint256).notice: Returns the amount of value tokens equivalent to a        given amount of branded tokens.

isUnrestricted(address).notice: Indicates whether an actor is unrestricted.

liftRestriction(address[]).notice: Maps addresses in _restrictionLifted to true in unrestricted.

redeem(uint256).notice: Reduces msg.sender's balance and the total supply by        _brandedTokens and transfers an equivalent amount of        value tokens to msg.sender.

rejectStakeRequest(bytes32).notice: Rejects stake request by deleting its information and        transferring staked value tokens back to staker.

requestStake(uint256,uint256).notice: Transfers value tokens from msg.sender to itself,        stores the amount of branded tokens to mint if request        is accepted, and emits stake request information.

revokeStakeRequest(bytes32).notice: Revokes stake request by deleting its information and        transferring staked value tokens back to staker.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Overrides EIP20Token.transfer by additionally        requiring msg.sender to be unrestricted.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Overrides EIP20Token.transferFrom by additionally        requiring msg.sender to be unrestricted.

userdoc.notice: Branded tokens are minted by staking specified value tokens.
